slide.title: An aerogramme issued by the Bangadesh Post Office Date of issue: 17 March, 1972

First postage stamp in India known as Scinde Dawk. Date of issue: July 1, 1852, by Sir Bartle Frere, the governor of Sind. The stamps had a circular design in red, white and blue colours on the embossed pieces of paper. Now the stamp is worth more than Rs 2 lakh.
Indian postage stamp Issued in 1854-55, India by East India Company with a value of 4annas featuring a young profile of Queen Victoria.
MA Salam has been featured on United Nations postage stamps in 2004.
20th anniversary of Independence 1971-1991 Date of Issue: 26-3-1991, Size: 36x36mm, Colour: Multicolour, Designer: Mahbub Alam
